# Product Management Skills

This page provides foundational resources for the core skills you'll develop during your APM internship.

## Product Discovery

Product discovery is the process of understanding customer needs and validating solutions before building.

### Key Activities
- Customer interviews
- Problem framing
- Opportunity assessment
- Solution validation

### Resources
- *Continuous Discovery Habits* by Teresa Torres
- *The Mom Test* by Rob Fitzpatrick

## Feature Definition & Prioritization

Turning insights into clear, actionable product requirements.

### Key Activities
- Writing user stories
- Defining acceptance criteria
- Prioritization frameworks (RICE, MoSCoW, etc.)
- Creating product requirements documents (PRDs)

### User Story Format
```
As a [type of user],
I want [goal/desire],
so that [benefit/value].
```

## Prototyping & Experimentation

Testing ideas quickly before committing to full development.

### Key Activities
- Low-fidelity wireframes
- Clickable prototypes
- A/B testing
- MVP definition

### Tools to Explore
- Figma (design & prototyping)
- Miro (whiteboarding)
- Notion (documentation)

## Analytics & Insights

Using data to inform product decisions.

### Key Activities
- Defining success metrics
- Analyzing user behavior
- Creating dashboards
- Presenting findings

### Common Metrics
- Activation rate
- Retention/churn
- Feature adoption
- Task completion rate

## Communication & Stakeholder Management

Product managers spend significant time communicating across teams.

### Key Skills
- Running effective meetings
- Writing clear documentation
- Presenting to stakeholders
- Managing competing priorities
